thinking.disposable_income: Beverly is a middle to upper-middle-class neighborhood with relatively high disposable income compared to other areas in Chicago. Residents can afford moderate increases in taxes and fees if it results in better services.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents in Beverly have a moderate to high level of discretionary consumption. They value quality of life improvements and are willing to invest in better services if it enhances their living standards.
thinking.accessibility: Beverly has decent access to public transportation, but many residents rely on cars for commuting. Improving transit times and services could encourage more residents to use public transportation.
thinking.decision_rationale: Given Beverly's higher disposable income, a moderate increase in sales tax and driving fees is acceptable if it significantly improves transit services. Lower transit fares are preferred to encourage public transportation use. Proposals with a balance of moderate tax, reasonable fare, and driving fees that improve transit times are prioritized. Proposals 10, 11, 13, 14, and 19 offer a good balance of improved transit times and costs, aligning with the community's ability to absorb moderate cost increases while enhancing service quality.
